macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: US Major Indices Close Lower on Friday Amid Warsh Fed Nomination
items.summary: S&P 500 fell 0.4% to 6939, Nasdaq dropped 0.9% to 23462, and DJIA declined 0.36% to 48892, pressured by higher Treasury yields and a stronger USD following President Trump's nomination of Kevin Warsh to succeed Fed Chair Powell, seen as signaling cautious easing. Despite Friday's losses, indices posted January gains: S&P 500 +1.4%, Dow +1.7%, Nasdaq +1%.[1][2][5]
items.source: FNArena, Emirates NBD Research, Trading Economics

items.title: Trump Nominates Kevin Warsh as Next Fed Chair
items.summary: President Trump nominated Kevin Warsh to replace Fed Chair Powell, viewed by markets as reinforcing a disciplined, cautious approach to rate easing, leading to higher US 10-year yields at 4.18% (+0.05%) and USD index rally to 96.86 (+0.83%). This weighed on rate-sensitive tech and materials sectors.[2][5]

items.title: Mixed Company Earnings: Apple Gains, Visa and AmEx Slip
items.summary: Apple rose 0.5% post-earnings on resilient iPhone sales despite stretched valuations; Visa fell 2.9% after priced-in beat; American Express dropped 1.8% on earnings miss; Verizon surged 11.8% on strong guidance; Chevron up 3.3% on profit beat.[1][5]

items.title: European and Asian Markets Mixed; ASX 200 Ends Week Up Slightly
items.summary: FTSE 100 rose 0.51% to 10223, DAX up 0.94% to 24538; ASX 200 closed week at 8869 (+0.1%) with energy (+4.25%) leading gains but IT down 6.61%; Saudi Tadawul fell 1.9%.[1][2]

items.title: Upcoming Central Bank Decisions and US Data in Focus
items.summary: This week features RBA rate decision (70% chance of hike to 3.85%), ECB and BoE meetings (expected to hold rates), and US ISM Manufacturing and jobs data; markets watch for policy signals amid recent yield moves.[4]

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: White House Convenes Meeting with Banks and Crypto Companies on Regulatory Compromise
items.summary: The White House is holding a meeting with banks and crypto companies on February 2nd (Eastern Time) to work toward a compromise on cryptocurrency legislation.

items.title: SEC Operations Paralyzed by U.S. Government Shutdown, Crypto Regulation Stalled
items.summary: The SEC has halted operations since January 31, 2026, due to a partial government shutdown, blocking regulatory progress on tokenized securities, DeFi frameworks, stablecoins, and Bitcoin ETF approvals. Resolution could come early next week if Congress votes on February 2.

items.title: Bitcoin Falls Nearly 5%, Ethereum Down 8.33% Amid Market Uncertainty
items.summary: Bitcoin dropped 4.92% to $78,797.90 and Ethereum fell 8.33% to $2,416.74 on Sunday, with Bitcoin hitting its lowest level since November 21 at $81,104 on Friday amid concerns over Fed policy under new chair nominee Kevin Warsh.

items.title: OKX Launches Palladium and Platinum Perpetual Contracts
items.summary: OKX will officially launch XPDUSDT and XPTUSDT perpetual contracts on February 2, 2026, expanding its offerings to include commodity-backed trading pairs.

items.title: Ethena (ENA) Token Unlock Scheduled for February 2
items.summary: Ethena will unlock approximately 40.63 million tokens (0.55% of circulating supply, worth ~$5.7 million) at 3 PM Beijing time on February 2.

items.title: Rainbow Crypto Wallet Launches CCA Auction on Uniswap
items.summary: Rainbow wallet announced a CCA mechanism auction on Uniswap on February 2, with 100% of proceeds becoming on-chain liquidity for RNBW tokens.

items.title: Zama Privacy Protocol Token Generation Event Scheduled for February 2
items.summary: The Zama crypto privacy protocol is holding its token generation event on February 2, with previously purchased tokens expected to be fully unlocked.

items.title: Abu Dhabi Royal Invests in Trump Crypto Venture World Liberty Financial
items.summary: An Abu Dhabi royal completed a secret deal to invest in World Liberty Financial, the Trump family's cryptocurrency venture, with the first installment of $250 million directed to Trump family entities and co-founders.

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.

items.title: SpaceX Plans 1-Million-Satellite Orbital Data Center System
items.summary: SpaceX announced plans to deploy a massive 1-million-satellite orbital data center system, expanding its space-based computing infrastructure. The initiative aims to revolutionize data processing in orbit.

items.title: SK hynix Invests $10 Billion in U.S.-Based Solutions Company
items.summary: SK hynix is investing $10 billion to create a new U.S.-based company focused on advanced solutions. This move strengthens its position in the semiconductor industry amid global expansion efforts.

items.title: Nvidia Invests $2 Billion in CoreWeave and Launches Vera CPU
items.summary: Nvidia announced a $2 billion investment in CoreWeave and standalone availability of its Vera CPU. The developments highlight ongoing advancements in high-performance computing hardware.

items.title: AMD and Eviden Unveil Europe's Second Exascale Supercomputer
items.summary: AMD partnered with Eviden to launch Europe's second exascale supercomputing system. This milestone boosts high-performance computing capabilities on the continent.

items.title: Start-up Claims World's First Quantum Computer from Standard Silicon
items.summary: A start-up announced the development of the world's first quantum computer built using standard silicon components. This breakthrough could make quantum tech more accessible and scalable.

items.title: New 3D Printing Process Improves Superconductors
items.summary: Researchers developed a novel 3D printing method that enhances superconductor performance. The innovation could lead to more efficient materials for energy and computing applications.

items.title: Big Changes Coming to USB Standards in 2026
items.summary: Significant updates to USB technology are set for 2026, driven by hyperscaler demands for advanced infrastructure. These changes extend beyond traditional AI hardware needs.
